action.action-desc: Mr. Cramer (for himself, Mr. Loebsack, Mr. Emmer, Mrs. Noem, and Mr. Peterson) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Agricultural Act of 2014 to require the Secretary of Agriculture to use certain data in determining an actual or benchmark county yield, and for other purposes.

section.header: Improvements to the Agriculture Risk Coverage Program
section.text: Section 1117(g)(4) of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9017(g)(4)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: in the case of county coverage—

subparagraph.text: effective beginning with actual yields for the 2017 crop year, assign an actual county yield for each planted acre for the crop year for the covered commodity—

clause.text: for a county for which county data collected by the Risk Management Agency is sufficient, as determined by the Secretary, to offer a county-wide insurance product using the actual average county yield determined by the Risk Management Agency; or
for a county not described in clause (i) using—

subclause.text: other sources of yield information (including consultation with the applicable State office of the Farm Service Agency); or
the yield history of representative farms in the State, region, or crop reporting district, as determined by the Secretary;

subparagraph.text: assign a benchmark county yield for a crop year using the actual county yield assigned in the prior crop year under subparagraph (A); and
make payments, as applicable, to producers using the payment rate of the county of the physical location of the base acres of a farm.
